p: SARS-CoV-2 is able to enter human cells by binding to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor, which is expressed in lung tissue, cardiac tissue, endothelial cells of blood vessels, the kidney, intestinal cells, hepatocytes, and pancreas cells [ 4], and which appears to have increased levels on the cells of people with diabetes, potentially thereby facilitating increased opportunity for the virus to infect cells [ 17].
